name: sand quarry operation, open pit mine | sand | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19568/documentation

This dataset describes the quarrying and processing of sand, usually applied in construction materials, from alluvial deposits in open pits in Brazil, which represents 30% of Brazilian production of sand for construction (MME, 2009), being the other 70% extracted from river beds. The wet sand mining process involves hydraulic mining of slopes and dredging of the pulp (sand and water) accumulated in the bottom of the pit, which is transported to the cyclone by pipes (therefore conveyor belts are not used in this process). Processing is done with the use of a cyclone for separating water and sand and classifying the sand particles according to its size: fine sand (between 0,15mm and 1,2 mm), medium sand (between 0,3 mm and 2,4 mm) and coarse sand (between 2,4 mm and 4,75 mm) - size classification is a commercial convention, based on the superseded version of ABNT NBR 7211. Sand is not washed and is only air dried (5% of humidity at the end of the process). The dataset includes the quarrying and size classification processes (information regarding weight proportion of sand particles according to its size not available though), as well as equipment maintenance. Machinery is taken into account within the dataset "diesel, burned in building machine", as most machinery runs on diesel. Administration buildings and the quarry’s end of life are not taken into account. Data were collected in 01 quarry located in the state of São Paulo, Brazil, which produces predominantly medium sand, with current technology. The representativeness of the dataset on a national scale is low (<1%).;MME - Ministério de Minas e Energia, 2009. Relatório Técnico 31 - Perfil da areia para construção civil. Available at: <http://www.mme.gov.br/documents/1138775/1256650/P22_RT31_Perfil_de_areia_para_construxo_civil.pdf/9745127c-6fdc-4b9f-9eda-13fa0146d27d>. Accessed 29.08.2017.;ABNT - Associação Brasileira de Normas Técnicas. ABNT NBR 7211 - Agregados para concreto - Especificação (National Standard).

From the extraction of sand from the alluvial deposit by excavation and hydraulic mining. Removal of the top soil layer (overburden) is not considered.

Includes the suctioning (by a dredge) of sand pulp originated from the hydraulic mining process and its pumping to the cyclone where sand is classified, the classification process, until the storage of sand in piles and its loading in trucks for delivery (but not the delivery itself). The dataset also includes the land use, with distinction of mineral extraction site, lakes (used for storing the water for hydraulic mining), internal unpaved roads and vegetated areas, based on information of the status of a quarry in 2016. Machinery is considered within the dataset "diesel burned in building machine". Recultivation of closed mines is not taken into account due to lack of data. No dust included because excavation is a "wet" process and water spray is used for dust control in internal transportation activities.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is set to the year 2016 as the data were collected in the year 2016
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset represents production of sand representative for Brazil. Data come from primary data collection in Brazil.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current technology for wet process of open pit sand mining in Brazil.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data from a specific state (São Paulo) and a small sample (one quarry) is extrapolated to represent the production in the whole country (Brazil). Basic uncertainty levels were extrapolated from the Brazilian gravel production process. The representativeness of the dataset on a national scale is low (<1%). Pedigree scores for completeness have been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Production control data gathered in 01 quarry located in the state of São Paulo (Brazil), thus with limited representativeness on a national scale.
Data was collected via questionnaire developed by the dataset authors and filled in by the quarry production and environmental manager. Data represent 01 year of quarry operation (2016).
Unit flows were calculated by dividing the amounts of inputs and outputs by the total sand production in mass, regardless of sand particle size. Water emission (evaporation) was modelled considering an evaporation rate of 100% water used for dust control (Vionnet et al. 2012), plus the water evaporated during natural drying based on expert opinion. Basic uncertainty was estimated based on the variations observed for gravel extraction in Brazil (not standard uncertainty values, except for specific flows) and additional uncertainty was estimated using Pedigree scores.
The amount of the exchanges were calculated considering the average of the sample. No conversion to the geometric mean of the lognormal distribution was done, for consistency reasons with other ecoinvent datasets.

exchanges.description: Sand used as aggregate for construction, usually applied in concrete production, mortar production, pavement layers, among others. According to the Brazilian standard ABNT NBR 7211, fine aggregates (which include sand) have a particle size of less than 4,75 mm. Sand sorted by grain size (information regarding weight proportion of sand particles according to its size not available).

exchanges.description: Estimation. No losses considered in the process. For 1 kg of wet sand for construction with 5% of humidity, 0.95 kg of sand comes from the environment

Calculated value. Water consumption reported for dust control estimated by manufacturer based on an average number of daily trips of water trucks that spray water over the facility. Water content of sand immediately after classification: 20% (estimated by manufacturer).

Estimation. Evaporation rate of water used for dust control of 100%, based on the evaporation rate for limestone mine (dust control) of Vionnet et al. 2012. Additional evaporation of water contained in the sand pulp.
Measured value. Vegetated area of the quarry was informed by the production manager, together with the total area of the quarry.
Measured value. Consumption informed by manufacturer for maintenance of equipment (replacement of old parts).

exchanges.description: Measured value. Total area of the quarry was informed by the production manager for 2016. The area was divided by the total production volume of the quarry until 2016. Total production volume was calculated based on 2016 yearly production multiplied by previous time (41 years).
Measured value. Area of mineral extraction of the quarry and internal unpaved roads was informed by the production manager, together with the total area of the quarry.
Measured value. Total building hall area 560m², service life assumed equal to "building hall" information (25 years).
